metadata.dc:description: Involvement of the duodenum in Crohn's disease is uncommon, and the pathomechanism of the associated acute pancreatitis remains controversial. We describe a case of Crohn's disease with duodenal involvement associated with hyperamylasemia and malabsorption showing a favorable response to steroid treatment.
metadata.dc:title: Pancreatitis aguda y malabsorción con tetania secundarias a enfermedad de Crohn con afectación duodenal.
[Acute pancreatitis and malabsorption with tetany secondary to Crohn's disease with duodenal involvement].
